text: Dichomeris helianthemi is a moth in the family Gelechiidae. It is found in Spain, France and Italy. The wingspan is about . The forewings are pale mouse- grey, sprinkled with fuscous scales and with a slight fuscous suffusion along the costa and three ill-defined fuscous spots along the disc, the first near the base and the second before the middle, the third at the end of the cell. The hindwings are pale stone-grey. The larvae feed on Helianthemum lavandulaefolium.Entomologist's Monthly Magazine 39 : 265 ==References== Category:Moths described in 1903 helianthemi
title: Dichomeris helianthemi
